original: HUGO, Åke Hugo, Direktör, Norrköping, f Furingsta 8/6 79 av kamr K H W Andersson 0 Hilda Brink, gm Alma Olsson. Studex Nrkp 97, elev John Lennings väfsk Nrkp 97—98, i sv ylleind 98—00 o École Sup des Textiles, Verviers, 01—02. Lär v J Lennings väfsk 00—01 o 11—13, anst i ylleind USA 02—08, kont.ch fma Knut Evers & Co Nrkp 09—15, samma fma Gbg 16—18, tjm stat ind.kommiss 18, dir.ass Borås WäfveriAB 18—20, vkst dir Sv bom.spinn imp.AB, Gbg, 20—22, Gen Cont Manager f bom.expfma Bush & Witherspoon Co, Waco, Texas, 22—26, anst STAB, tjg i Belg, Ung o Alg 26—30, vkst dir Sv ullimp.-frn 1939 upa o dir Sv ylleind.frn sed. 39. Etabl eg ag.aff f textila råvaror 32. Stat repr 1 styr f fi imp.frn:ar 18. V. pres All Franc de Nrkp sed. 43, sekr Nrkps Rotary 34—39, pres 39—41. Studie- o aff.res Belg 01—02, USA 02—08, 15, 22 o 26, krigsres Hamb—Berl —Brem 16, bomullskongr Zurich, Liverpool, Manch o Paris 20—21, tj.res i de fi europ länd 22—30, bosatt Bryssel 23—24 o 26—28, Bremen 24—25, Alg 29—30. Av trycket: Div upps i fackl ämn i Skand Månadsskr f Tex-tilind o dagspressen. Hobbies: Arbetet, böcker, mänskor.
translated: HUGO, Åke Hugo, Director, Norrköping, born in Furingsta on June 8, 1879, son of merchant K H W Andersson and Hilda Brink, married to Alma Olsson. Studied at Nrkp (Norrköping) in 1897, student at John Lennings väfsk (weaving school) in Nrkp in 1897-1898, in the Swedish wool industry from 1898-1900 and at École Sup des Textiles in Verviers from 1901-1902. Teacher at J Lennings väfsk in 1900-1901 and 1911-1913, employed in the wool industry in the USA from 1902-1908, accountant at Knut Evers & Co in Nrkp from 1909-1915, same company in Gbg (Gothenburg) from 1916-1918, temporary employee at the state industrial committee in 1918, assistant director at Borås WäfveriAB from 1918-1920, deputy director at Swedish cotton spinning import company in Gbg from 1920-1922, General Controlling Manager at cotton export company Bush & Witherspoon Co in Waco, Texas from 1922-1926, employed by STAB, served in Belgium, Hungary, and Algeria from 1926-1930, deputy director at Swedish wool import company from 1939 onwards and director of Swedish wool industry since 1939. Established own agency for textile raw materials in 1932. Appointed representative for 1st board of directors of fi (unknown abbreviation) import company from 1918. Vice president of All Franc de Nrkp since 1943, secretary of Nrkp's Rotary club from 1934-1939, president from 1939-1941. Study and business trips to Belgium in 1901-1902, USA in 1902-1908, 1915, 1922 and 1926, war trips to Hamburg-Berlin-Bremen in 1916, cotton congress in Zurich, Liverpool, Manchester and Paris in 1920-1921, business trips to several European countries from 1922-1930, resided in Brussels in 1923-1924 and 1926-1928, Bremen in 1924-1925, Algeria in 1929-1930. Published various articles in Scandinavian monthly magazine for the textile industry and the daily press. Hobbies: Work, books, people.

structured.name: Åke Hugo Hugo
structured.description: HUGO, Åke Hugo, Director, Norrköping, born in Furingsta on June 8, 1879, son of merchant K H W Andersson and Hilda Brink, married to Alma Olsson. Studied at Nrkp (Norrköping) in 1897, student at John Lennings väfsk (weaving school) in Nrkp in 1897-1898, in the Swedish wool industry from 1898-1900 and at École Sup des Textiles in Verviers from 1901-1902. Study and business trips to Belgium in 1901-1902, USA in 1902-1908, 1915, 1922 and 1926, war trips to Hamburg-Berlin-Bremen in 1916, cotton congress in Zurich, Liverpool, Manchester and Paris in 1920-1921, business trips to several European countries from 1922-1930, resided in Brussels in 1923-1924 and 1926-1928, Bremen in 1924-1925, Algeria in 1929-1930. career.occupational_title: Deputy Director (Swedish Cotton Spinning Import Company)
